post_text:
11:25am on 3.24.20

As per Executive Order 104, item #2, NJ Governor Murphy has ordered all schools in NJ closed indefinitely. Thus, it will require the State notifying us as to when we will eventually re-open in-person school operations.

Those families participating in the National School Lunch Program can continue to pick up meals (now as per Executive Order, for up to 3 days of meals at one time) from 10:00am - 12:15pm at Boonton HS (under covered walkway) and School Street School (lower parking lot off Liberty Street). LP resident students can pick up meals starting at 10:30am at LPMS. Please bring your own bags and maintain social distancing at all times.

There will be an evening update later today.

Robert Presuto
Superintendent
text:
11:25am on 3.24.20

As per Executive Order 104, item #2, NJ Governor Murphy has ordered all schools in NJ closed indefinitely. Thus, it will require the State notifying us as to when we will eventually re-open in-person school operations.

Those families participating in the National School Lunch Program can continue to pick up meals (now as per Executive Order, for up to 3 days of meals at one time) from 10:00am - 12:15pm at Boonton HS (under covered walkway) and School Street School (lower parking lot off Liberty Street). LP resident students can pick up meals starting at 10:30am at LPMS. Please bring your own bags and maintain social distancing at all times.

There will be an evening update later today.

Robert Presuto

If you did not receive the mass email messages sent yesterday (3.15.20) from the school district, please check your SPAM folder before notifing us.

Please add <do_not_reply4@boontonschools.org> to your NOT SPAM list.

In particular, folks using Yahoo mail accounts appear to be reporting they did not receive these emails more than any other email system users.

https://help.yahoo.com/kb/manage-spam-mailing-lists-yahoo-mail-sln28056.html

post_text: In order to better prepare for possible extended school closures, Boonton Public Schools will have their remaining full-day PD session this Friday, March 13th (originally on the calendar for May 18th). As such there will be no school this Friday. A detailed message from the Superintendent will go via eBlast out this afternoon.

post_text: Our Bomber football team will be playing Park Ridge this Saturday, November 30th @1:00 PM at MetLife stadium in East Rutherford for the North Regional Final championship. General admission tickets are $12 for adults and $3 for K-12 students and Senior Citizens. Parking is $15. Tickets will be available for purchase 1 hour prior to game time at the stadium. Additional ticket information (including advanced purchase) will be made available as we obtain more details.

post_text: This is a really nice event right here in Boonton for children and adults alike this evening. Weather appears to be perfect as well.
shared_text:
Boonton Arts is supporting Boonton Arts at Grace Lord Park.
October 25, 2018 at 11:08 AM · Boonton, NJ ·

Tonight! Boonton Arts invites you to our 3rd annual Pumpkin Illumination in beautiful Grace Lord Park beginning at 5:30pm

5:30pm-7pm
-Bring your carved pumpkin and get a good spot on the gazebo.
-Enjoy live jazz by The Lintet
- Participate in a mask-making workshop with illustrator, Matt Keown.
- Take a selfie with Frankie!
- Enjoy Grace Lord Park's awesome playground!

7pm-7:15pm
– Pumpkins Illuminated! The announcement of the prize-winning carved pumpkins.

7:15pm
- Luminary Parade finale featuring masks created by the mask making workshop participants!

post_text:
From the Boonton-Holmes Public Library:

August Mini Summer Camp for Kids

We are pleased to announce our first ever "mini summer camp" for kids. Starting on August 7, the camp will run three mornings a week, Tuesday-Wednesday-Thursday, through August 30. Open to Boonton children, ages 7 and up, the camp offers a variety of activities.

Tuesdays, 10:30 a.m.-12 noon: Foodie Fun for All
Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.-12 noon: Crazy Creative Crafts
Thursdays, 10:30 a.m.-12 noon: STEM Workshops brought by the MakerProject

Space is limited so registration is required, please. $15 per child (up to $30 per family) for 3 workshops.
text:

Tuesdays, 10:30 a.m.-12 noon: Foodie Fun for All
Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.-12 noon: Crazy Creative Crafts
Thursdays, 10:30 a.m.-12 noon: STEM Workshops brought by the MakerProject

Space is limited so registration is required, please. $15 per child (up to $30 per family) for 3 workshops.

Attention Boonton Friends and Families!

What better way to celebrate the strength of our amazing schools, community, and town (especially with recent events) than by sporting your very own “Boonton Strong” t-shirt! Orders are due by Friday, 3/23! Please see the order form below and if you have any questions, email me at allyson.gerdes@gmail.com!

post_text:
March 9, 2018 @9:45 AM

Both BHS and JHS still are without power this morning. As a result there continues to be no phone or Internet service in any of the buildings.

We are continuing to develop the school schedule for next week in terms of where/when to have high school classes. There are numerous modifications to be made so please understand this is a complex re-scheduling of each school's operations.

A mass notification will go out once the plan is finalized for next week.
text:
March 9, 2018 @9:45 AM

Both BHS and JHS still are without power this morning. As a result there continues to be no phone or Internet service in any of the buildings.

We are continuing to develop the school schedule for next week in terms of where/when to have high school classes. There are numerous modifications to be made so please understand this is a complex re-scheduling of each school's operations.

A mass notification will go out once the plan is finalized for next week.

post_text:
The Bridges to Learning Preschool program is currently accepting registrations for the 2017-2018 school year. The preschool is a full-day, tuition-based program that follows the New Jersey Department of Education's approved Tools of the Mind curriculum. The program, located at School Street School, is open to residents and non-residents.
To learn more, please visit during our Open House on Wednesday, April 5 from 6:30 pm to 8:00 pm. (Parents only please)

View more information, please visit

http://www.edline.net/files/_aUKfD_/25cf67141fd276473745a49013852ec4/bridges_preschool_openhouse.pdf

post_text:
Are you familiar with the district's 5 Max attendance initiative?

Attendance in school is one of the most important facets of success in school and we're encouraging students and parents to accrue no more than 5 absences for the year. Students with chronically high rates of absenteeism often struggle academically and have lower HS graduation rates.

Thank you to BHS student Jeremy Irvine who designed the logo!
